job_title: Part-Time Faculty in Santa Maria, CA
pros: I was really impressed with what this little school is capable of. Many options for professional and personal development, within or outside of the job.
cons: Structurally, some employees may fall between the cracks (during onboarding, trainings, etc.)

job_title: Community Education Instructor in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Flexible hours with morning and/or evening classes
cons: Little to no benefits for part-time instructors

job_title: Director in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Some staff and students are fantastic and can make the place bearable.
cons: Low pay, inflexible work hours, incompetent staff, no onboarding, gaslighting, aggressive students, sexual harassment not taken seriously, homophobic, and the CEO surrounds himself with women of color to hide his racism.

review_title: Student Centered but Not Employee Centered
job_title: Community Education Coordinator in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Very student centered, fun job if you like a challenge, great for someone who is "big picture" minded.
cons: The department is great, but HR is a hot mess!

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Maria, CA
pros: If you're a student, you'll be treated like gold.
cons: Allan Hancock College is a complete shit-show rife with incompetence, low pay, and inefficient, paper-based processes. There is also an egregious resistance to change here, with admins and faculty undertaking the same cumbersome processes that were done 20 years ago. Student Services is a mess and led by incompetent, vindictive people who can't take any constructive criticism. Don't work here.

job_title: Tutor in Santa Maria, CA
pros: They work around your class schedule!
cons: You don’t get enough hours.

review_title: COVID-19 Response Has Been a Mess
job_title: Assistant Professor in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Hancock is very student-centered, and there is a lot of opportunity for professional growth. It's in a great, central location in CA, close to wineries and the coast. The pay is decent, and there are opportunities to earn above one's base salary by teaching extra classes.
cons: Upper administration rushed to bring students back mid-pandemic with very little planning or concern for the health of their students, staff, and faculty, resulting in a chaotic and contentious campus environment. They are making adjustments now, but it's too little, too late. The health insurance they offer is astronomical, so a good chunk of your paycheck will go towards it (a good plan for a family of 3 will set you back $1500 a month).

review_title: Extremely low pay, but not a bad working working atmosphere
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Smaller school so you are able to get classes assigned to you easier.
cons: Pay, do not really care about their part-time faculty

job_title: Counselor in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Great colleagues, schedule and students!

job_title: Office Services Technician in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Steady job with job security, salary job with additional pay if you worked overtime, you make a difference in students' lives
cons: Sometimes short-staffed for the amount of work. Sometimes leads to overtime (paid additionally to salary)

job_title: Office Assistant in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Flexible hours and assist in professional growth.
cons: Didn't experience any cons while working here.

job_title: Program Assistant in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Everyone is very friendly and helpful
cons: Nothing, I like it here

job_title: Specialist in Santa Maria, CA
pros: I have taught and worked as a classified employee, and the classroom environment is way better.  Student experience is pretty good and it is possible to have strong student to faculty relationships.  That’s where the pros end.
cons: Administrative culture is very catty and backstabbing, where everyone is trying to CYA from the top down, so things end up getting blamed on lower level full time employees, and it takes forever to get simple things done.  Students suffer for this, and workplace culture becomes untrusting and unhealthy.  Many shady and even illegal things happening at higher levels of administration on a day to day basis.  This is including very serious reports being swept under the rug to protect the image of the college.  This side of campus is simply an awful work environment.  I don’t advise working here.

job_title: Music Instructor in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Paid staff enrichment classes is a nice benefit to working at AHC. Work environment is warm and inviting. Campus is clean and well cared for. Great tutorial services for students with learning issues. Fabulous support for special needs students.
cons: The music building is very old and dated and is in dire need of updating and upgrading. Tiles are worn and ceiling fluorescent lighting is often missing ceiling covers. A good coat of paint would go a long way.  Parking is a bit of a hassle. Ceiling tiles are stained from water damage over the years and it looks bad.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Maria, CA
pros: I enjoyed what I did working in the Law Enforcement Academy Training Department.  I worked part-time (20-hours per week) I scheduled advanced officer training for California peace officers.
cons: The woman who trained me and was the full-time administrative assistant in the office was the most difficult person I have ever worked with and I have been in the administrative/human resources fields for over 30 years.  She had no idea how to train someone and I was not trained properly; thus I was fired for not doing my job correctly!

job_title: Peer Tutor in Santa Maria, CA
pros: The staff is nice and it is a good thing to be paid by the school in order to help schoolmates. Working with students also builds friendships and relationships.
cons: The hourly wage is a minimum wage and most of the time the students make appointments in the worst hours of the day.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Good work experience, easy job once you remember procedures, always busy, good pay and they work around your school schedule.
cons: Bad leadership, you don't get alot of days off from your work schedule, no benifits, low work hours, and alot of times you don't get recognition for doing a good job, no job promotions unless you kiss some serious ass.

review_title: A fine place to work, not much else
